metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6668 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 3.24.35.10, asused in Google Chrome before 33.0.1750.146, allow attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-chromedriver - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
oxideqmlscene - 1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1').
oxide-qt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~bzr452-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
